title: STYO Tech Neon logo assets + SVG Verified badge

requirements.summary: Add Tech Neon STYO primary logo assets (full, icon-only, and white monochrome) as SVG + transparent PNG under generated assets.
acceptanceCriteria: New logo assets exist under frontend/public/assets/generated using the filenames specified in imageRequirements.
Full logo includes both icon and the text “STYO” and remains legible on dark backgrounds.
SVGs render correctly at small and large sizes without pixelation and without filter-heavy effects that bloat file size.

file_operations.description: Add generated Tech Neon full logo SVG (icon + “STYO”), optimized for dark UI and lightweight SVG markup.
Add generated Tech Neon full logo transparent PNG for sharing/metadata usage.
Add generated Tech Neon icon-only SVG for app icon usage.
Add generated Tech Neon icon-only transparent PNG for favicon/app icon usage.
Add generated white monochrome full logo SVG (transparent background) for dark UI fallback/contrast scenarios.
Add generated white monochrome full logo transparent PNG.
Add generated white monochrome icon-only SVG (transparent background).
Add generated white monochrome icon-only transparent PNG.

requirements.summary: Replace header/footer branding and index.html metadata/favicon to consistently use the new Tech Neon logo assets.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/components/Header.tsx and frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx use the new full-logo asset path(s) under /assets/generated/ and no longer reference /assets/generated/styo-logo-transparent.dim_200x80.png.
frontend/index.html favicon link uses the new icon-only asset (not the full logo).
frontend/index.html og:image and twitter:image use an appropriate new logo image (PNG) under /assets/generated/.
Logo remains crisp on mobile and desktop (no layout shift; responsive sizing preserved).

file_operations.description: Update brand image to use the new full Tech Neon logo asset under frontend/public/assets/generated (replace prior reference to /assets/generated/styo-logo-transparent.dim_200x80.png) while keeping responsive sizing and no layout shift.

Update footer brand image to use the new full Tech Neon logo asset under frontend/public/assets/generated (replace prior reference to /assets/generated/styo-logo-transparent.dim_200x80.png) while preserving existing layout.

Update favicon to frontend/public/assets/generated/styo-logo-tech-neon-icon.dim_512x512.png, and update og:image + twitter:image to frontend/public/assets/generated/styo-logo-tech-neon-full.dim_1200x400.png (replacing prior references to styo-logo-transparent.dim_200x80.png).

requirements.summary: Create a reusable inline-SVG Gold Verified badge component with a prop-based variant API for future badge types.
acceptanceCriteria: A new reusable React component exists (e.g., in frontend/src/components/) that renders the Verified badge as inline SVG (no raster images).
The component supports common customization via props (at minimum: size and className; plus a variant/type pattern suitable for adding Featured/Premium/Elite later).
SVG uses a gold gradient and subtle glow effect while remaining lightweight (avoid large embedded bitmaps or excessively complex filters).
Component is responsive (renders cleanly at small sizes such as within a listing card).

file_operations.description: Create a reusable React component that renders an inline SVG trust badge. Implement a 'variant' prop pattern (starting with 'verified') plus size and className props; use a gold gradient and subtle, lightweight glow (avoid heavy filters) and keep SVG markup web-performance-friendly.

requirements.summary: Replace listing-card Verified pill with the new SVG Verified badge driven by listing.verified.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/ListingCard.tsx, when listing.verified is true, the UI displays the new SVG Gold Verified badge instead of (or in place of) the existing green “Verified” pill at the top-left of the image area.
The listing card remains visually balanced on small screens (badge does not overflow or cover critical content).
No backend changes are required to render the badge; it uses existing listing.verified data.

file_operations.description: Import and render the new TrustBadge component in the image area when listing.verified is true, replacing the existing green Verified pill at top-left; ensure responsive sizing/positioning and keep the badge driven solely by listing.verified (no additional data fetching).
